title: Sick of playing agianst hackers/cheaters
body:
Why do I have to be match against players who cheat all the time?
I've talked to a number of players who constantly cheat and can spot it from a mile away.
They play with cheats constantly with no fear of repercussions.

I swear there is at least one person using evade scripts in every match, pulling of continuous inhuman speed doges. 
What is the strategy for dealing with this?

I'm temped to start doing it because the advantage is hugely unfair.
But I don't want to, it seems to completely negate the point of playing a skill based game.
It ruins the challenge and fun of the game.

URF is especially bad, I doubt there are many humans alive with the reflexes required to pull of the shit you see people doing with cheats.

replies.body:
I'm doubtful that there's anyone actually using cheats, unless it's related to what elo you're at, but even then, if they don't have the decision making it will do them no good.

The client can automatically detect if you're using scripts and such to gain an unfair advantage in game, and your account will be automatically permanently banned for breaking the EULA.

I think that the people you're versing either have a better connection than you, or genuinely have better reflexes.

I think I need to explain...
There are in fact cheats for LoL.
There are two main systems for it that many people write scripts.
For all different champions, thing like auto evade, auto combos, detect if a kill and be made an do it automatic, etc.
I've been on the forums and I've actually reviewed the code of a few of them.

There are in fact cheats, Riot does know about them.
Riots policy in the past has been to payroll the hackers writing the cheats!
The issue I have is that Riot does not actually have a proper anti-cheat system like VAC.
And the scripts / bots are able to access the games internal API and write to memory with out being detected.

Oh, maybe I've misplaced my faith. I was just going on my personal experience that I've never encountered a(n obvious) cheater. If all they're doing is what is technically possible in-game, then the system probably wouldn't detect it.

Not to say that it's fine to cheat, because it's not, but then you get into the realm of allowing players to customise their game. Like, is allowing players to unlock their camera give them an inherit, and unfair advantage to players who don't? Very bad example, but hopefully my point got across.

It's a fine line. If they disable the API, then obviously people will get annoyed for legitimate reasons, but leaving the API as it is allows people to make these exploiting programs.

I think the best solution would be to change the API so that champions positions and in-game items aren't technologically visible. That way only programs that can tap into the client themselves to read particular code would still be able to cheat, and they might trigger the client's anti-scripting mechanism in doing so.

Riot members don't hang around the Help & Support boards much, you'll have a much better chance of getting their attention on the Miscellaneous boards. If you could get some evidence of it happening, such as a game-recording that was uploaded to Youtube of the most recent patch (with a very obvious scripter), then something *might* be done about it in the background.

It's a shame that you seem to run into so many, or it's a shame that I fail to notice all the ones I run into.

But I gotta say, I like the challenge. What is more satisfying then beating a computer with millisecond reaction times in a reaction-based game?
